Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
The Historically Black Colleges and Universities - Undergraduate Program (HBCU-UP) supports conferences that seek to increase the research capacity of science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) faculty at HBCUs. North Carolina Central University will collaborate with the University of North Carolina - Chapel Hill to host a Conference on Nonparametric Statistics at the Hill Alumni Center, Chapel Hill, NC, on October 16-17, 2018. About eighty faculty and students from North Carolina Central University will attend this conference.

Data in biomedical sciences, the social sciences, and other fields often involve non-standard designs and very high dimensions with relatively small sample sizes with complex dependency structure. Standard models and associated statistical packages, mostly based on parametric statistics, are often of limited scope in these complex set-ups. For such models, nonparametric approaches would apply. This conference is to bring together scholars, researchers, educators, students and professionals who are interested in this important area of statistics. A key objective is to provide researchers and students from North Carolina Central University with the opportunity to interact with a group of researchers and to strengthen capacity in this area of statistics.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The goal of the conference is to bring together scholars, researchers, educators, students and professionals who are interested in the general area of nonparametrics in modern biomedical and clinical sciences. A key objective is to provide researchers and students of North Carolina Central University (NCCU) the opportunity to interact with distinguished group of researchers and to begin to build capacity in this area of research.

 Intellectual Merit:

Our project team collaborated with the Department of Biostatistics, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill (UNC-CH) in planning and organining the nonparametric conference, and the result was the conference "From Non-Parametrics to Machine Learning and Precision Health", held October 28-29, 2019. Seven methodology sessions, along with a poster session, were held. The major topics of discussion and exchange were: Machine Learning, Clinical Trials, Survival Analysis, Causal Inference/Precision Health, Non-Parametrics, Statistical Genetics, and Big Data.

 Broader Impacts:

The nonparametric conference brought together over 130 scholars, researchers, educators, students and professionals who are interested to exchange ideas for novel methods for handling complex and disparate data and to explore directions towards supportive new techniques and tools. The co-sponsored conference also promoted the UNC Biostatistics 70th Anniversary Celebration of Research, Service and Training, and hosted special sessions that highlighted scientific contributions of researchers and students from HBCUs.


Last Modified: 06/17/2020
Modified by: Caesar Jackson
